messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Preschoolers bombed with commercialism in new movie
messages.msgSnippet: My teenagers (16 & 17) took my 4yo to see it last night. They said it tried very hard to be funny for everyone -- little kids, teens, adults -- and failed on
messages.messageBody:
My teenagers (16 & 17) took my 4yo to see it last night. They said it tried very hard to be funny for everyone -- little kids, teens, adults -- and failed on all counts (they both are big Mike Myers fans). Little ds said it LOOKED like the cat in the book, but he sure didn't ACT like him.

Kay


As for the movie, I think the original poster was asking if it was
appropriate for preschoolers - and I have to say that I don't think it is.
I don't think there's anything in it to scar them for life, but there's
enough tacky stuff that I think I'd just pass on it for my kid if he were
still little.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
